isis.stitle: BRAKE COMPONENTS - STOP LIGHT SWITCH - SERVICE CHECKS

step1.para: Both stop light switches must be checked independently to be sure they are functioning. Disconnect one switch.
Apply the brake and note that with first downward movement of pedal or treadle, the stop lights come on.
Release the brakes and note that stop lights go off.

note.para: Before going any further with your diagnosis, be sure that the bulb is in working order.

step1.para: If stop lights do not go on, use a test light at stop light connections. Test both terminals to determine if an electrical supply is available at switch; then"by-pass"switch with test light or jumper wire. Lights should go on. If not, a failure in the electrical circuit is the problem. However, if lights work, replace stop light switch.
Repeat Step 4 to check second light switch.

svcsubproc.title: Leakage Test
svcsubproc.para: With brakes applied, there should be no air leakage at stop light switch.
Cover the switch with soap solution. If a leak is indicated, replace switch.
